Haley if he's so tell he'll come at how
come I haven't seen a man I hate him I
hate council justice of Montreal is a
band who over the years has dabbled in a
lot of musical styles whether it be
psychedelic pop or funk or maybe on this
album a little bit of R&B but it doesn't
matter what style they're pursuing
whatever type of music they're playing
it's guaranteed to be something that
completely just lets go of its
inhibitions around releases like some
lanta twins and hissing fauna frontman
Kevin Barnes started embracing really
flamboyant rock front men like David
Bowie or Boy George or Prince the music
became more gaudy as well like so
overblown so many kaleidoscopic sounds
and colors to listen to just very
overloaded and though I do think of
Montreal got a lot weirder I have to
admit Kevin Barnes songwriting did get
more ambitious and his production chops
got a lot better
Barnes lyrics got more interesting too
creating characters and making these
really cryptic references that drive
fans nuts wondering who or what the hell
he's talking about there are a lot more
electronics in the music too but false
priest
believe it or not is somewhat of a step
away from that maybe a little closer
toward more natural instrumentation not
that you can find a drum set in nature
but follow me on this one though the
instrumentation here may be a little
clearer than it has been for the past
few LPS for Oh
Nouriel Kevin Barnes vocal delivery is
more unashamed than ever he just
continues to do all of these really
wacky falsettos on all of the songs
which are weird enough alone but here he
started layering them on top of each
other like it ain't no thing there's a
little more guitar on this LP there's a
little more drums on this thing but the
music still sounds very one-track very
rigid there's a ton of synthesizers on
here which I'm sure most of Montreal
fans are used to by now and that Beatles
esque bass guitar that has pretty much
been there since almost the beginning is
still stand and strong on this LP too
though maybe it's not as loud as it used
to be some songs are really quick and
poppy and accessible like the song enemy
gene where Janelle Monae actually shows
up to help in the vocal department while
other songs are really memorable just
because of how strange they are like
Kevin Barnes narrating about this very
very dangerous abusive relationship on a
riotous defects I mean that she killed
his beta fish-- my issue with most of
this LP is I wish Kevin Barnes wasn't
trying to just pour 10 gallons of sound
into my head within a 30 second timespan
the bizarre nature of this album just
its demeanor distracts away from the
music more than it adds to it though I
will say lyrical moments like you look
like a playground to me that's just
Kevin Barnes flirting with being a
genius if you would in fact allow me to
call him a genius I know Kevin Barnes
can write a decent pop song when he just
steps back and calms down a little bit
he's done it before
and he does it on this LP with famine
affair however at least more than half
the time I find that all of the
instrumentation and all the sounds all
the synths are so layered on top of each
other that is just this orgy of sound
that I really have no desire to reach
into and kind of pull apart I'm feeling
a light 5 almost a strong 4 on this LP
and is because all the songs are really
boring to me no not
all it's actually because I love a lot
of these songs but I hate a lot of them
too but what does it matter
like Kevin Barnes says in the track
there's nothing wrong with hating rock
critics
I don't create I just critique but what
